record.dc:title: 5-156 Irwin Village Site 12CP5, Campbell County, Tennessee. Mound 1. Feature 19, Circular arrangement of rocks surrounding post mold.
record.wpa:narrative: The remains of a piece of post situated in a post mold that extended about 2" into the hard pan. The post was surrounded by a circular arrangement of rocks. Seven irregular limestone rocks roughly in a circle outline around the post. See photo 5-153. The tip of this post extended about 6" above the mound floor while the remaining portion extended down into the hard pan into which it projected a distance of 2". Upon digging out the post mold for this post it was seen to be circular and the bottom of the hole was shaped like a flat bowl. No side extensions could be followed from the post mold thus seemingly the post was in reality placed in this position and was not a tree.
record.wpa:comments: No record on file for this photograph. However, narrative information for Feature 19 is available. See also photographs 5-152 [fhm00539], 5-153 [fhm00540], 5-154 [fhm00541], and 5-155 [fhm00542].
